Purpose of Home Device Manager. Home Device Manager allows broadband providers to remotely manage CPE (customer premises equipment), such as residential gateways, DSL and cable modems, femtocell access points, IP set-top boxes, and VoIP terminal adapters. Allowing for large-scale remote management of a multi-vendor CPE network, Home Device Manager offers a standardized CPE integration layer that enables providers to manage CPE that support either the Broadband Forum's TR-069 protocol or other protocols such as Telnet.

row.entry: ID
Summary
Description
HDM throws an exception when the USP device sends any notifications prior to the OnBoard notification

Symptoms. HDM encounters a NullPointerException (NPE) when it receives notifications from the USP devices before the OnBoard notification, Due to these exceptions, trace log file grows quickly.
Resolution. This issue occurs due to the absence of the DeviceID triplet for the agent's endpointID. This issue has been fixed in this release.
The firmware upgrade custom function fails because required parameters are missing in the USP event notifications

Symptoms. The firmware upgrade function fails to complete successfully. This issue also affects other custom functions that depend on the same parameters.
Resolution. The root cause is missing parameters in _inform.getParameters(), impacting all USP devices using this functionality. This issue has been fixed in this release.
Issue with HDMADMIN console displaying domains incorrectly in HDM 23

entry.p: Symptoms. When a user logs in to the /hdmadmin console and clicks on the Domains tab, an error message appears if the logged-in user has the HDM_Domain_Administrator role but does not belong to any domain.
Resolution. The resolution is to provide an appropriate message to the user when the issue occurs. This issue has been fixed in this release.

row.entry: TR-181 devices fail to retry CF activation after Activation.waitForOSSDataTimeoutSecs timeout, leaving users non-activated

entry.p: Symptoms. For TR-181 devices, the activation does not retry upon getting stuck at waiting for provisioning information state as they don't make use of SCE Activation.waitForOSSDataTimeoutSecs.
Resolution. This issue has been fixed in this release and the same SCE now serves both TR098 and TR181 devices.

row.entry: Communication log via UI, NBI, manually and more, for specific devices is not turned on by default

entry.p: Symptoms. By default, the communication log for specific devices is disabled during the zero activation process. Users can only manually enable the communication log through the UI, NBI, or other methods after the device is created. As a result, any issues or inconsistencies in device communication are not captured for debugging purposes.
Resolution. Any device activated during zero touch activation mode, the communication log can now be enabled by default, using SCE parameter : communication.logging.enable.on.activation = true.
The default value is "false". To turn it on, users need to set the value to "true" and no cluster restart is required post setting this SCE.

row.entry: The Install command and path in JSonUtil.java are incorrect, causing issues during software module installation

entry.p: Symptoms. The current Install() command and its path are incorrect, leading to installation failures. Users may experience errors during the installation process, and the software modules may not be deployed correctly.

Resolution. Update the Install command and path from Device.SoftwareModules.DeploymentUnit.[UUID=="<UUID_val>"].Install() to Device.SoftwareModules.InstallDU() to resolve the installation issues. This issue has been fixed in this release.

row.entry: Domain based filtering of HDM artefacts fails to work when upgraded from HDM 20.2 to HDM 23.0.4

entry.p: Symptoms. Domain based filtering of HDM objects does not work as expected and hierarchical rules are not followed. This bug has been present since HDM R 23.
Resolution. This issue has been fixed in this release.

row.entry: Redis errors after upgrade to version 6.2.13 for HDM as part of the 24.0.1 release

entry.p: Symptoms. When a user upgrades to Redis version 6.2.13 for HDM as part of the 24.0.1 release, it causes Redis exceptions and errors. Restarting Redis and HDM Cluster does not seem to fix this issue.
Resolution. This issue has been fixed in this release.
Note: Redis cluster is not supported with USP.

row.entry: USP CPE devices failed to connect with MQTT broker because broker credentials were not persistent

Symptoms. When USP devices are activated using Pre-provisioning mode. There are two unexpected behaviour such as:
When a user tries to connect to the MQTT broker using the broker's username and password, the connection fails.
A USP device could connect to the broker using the broker username and password of another device.
Resolution. Both issues have been resolved in this release.
On HDM 23.0.0, The Rest NBI Resource PUT /alarmDefinitions/<alarmName> ignores the field "filterParameters"

entry.p: Symptoms. On HDM 23.0.0, The Rest NBI Resource PUT /alarmDefinitions/<alarmName> ignores the field "filterParameters".
Resolution. This issue has been fixed in this release by removing the filterParameters Array Value Device.X_SWISSCOM-COM_DeviceManagement.FirewallLevel2.

row.entry: HTTP 400 error encountered while saving certain IWE scripts

entry.p: Symptoms. It is observed that IWE returns an HTTP 400 error when saving a script. Even if no actual update is performed, clicking Save returns the error. The expected behavior should allow IWE scripts containing strings with single quotes. However, if the script contains 'and' and 'or', the IWE console throws an error.

Resolution. A pop-up error message and logging have been added to address this issue. When "<space>and<space>" or "<space>or<space>" is added in any section of an IWE script (including comments), an error dialogue is displayed to the user and the script will not be saved. In addition, the error will be logged in the iwe.log file, stating that:

p.i: Text ' and ', ' or ' are not permitted in IWE script, not even in comments section hence Security filter REJECTS HTTP param (SQL inject)

entry.p: This is applicable for both old and new IWE consoles.
This issue has been fixed in this release.
